arts.ttl: Rhys Carr singles out 'outstanding' Coventry City man in battling Sunderland comeback
arts.sum: “We spoke to the players at half-time and made some tactical tweaks, spoke about the character that was going to be needed, and I am so proud and pleased and happy for the group of players in there that they showed in the second half, which was fantastic,” said Carr, reflecting on the 2-2 draw and his first game as interim head coach. Asked about his first experience of taking the team at this level, Carr said: “I have just had to take two paracetemol before coming in here because I have a bit of a headache but it is not about myself, it is about the players and those supporters who travelled a long way from Coventry .

arts.ttl: Managerless Coventry fight back to hold leaders Sunderland
arts.sum: Two second-half goals from managerless Coventry earned a 2-2 draw at Sunderland after the leaders had conjured up a couple of special finishes to take control.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings after determined comeback and point at leaders Sunderland - Andy Turner
arts.sum: City then gave away possession in their own half to allow Dennis Cirkin to go on a brilliant run upfield that saw him play a one-two and then unleash a powerful shot into the top corner from just outside the area, giving Collins no chance again, in a half that saw Coventry create just two efforts themselves, both hit off target. Haji Wright then gave City a lifeline back into the game when he picked up a stray pass just outside the box, turned smartly and drilled home into the bottom corner, making it 2-1 just after the hour.

arts.ttl: Managerless Coventry fight back to stun leaders Sunderland
arts.sum: The Sky Blues were trailing by two goals after an hour.

arts.ttl: Sunderland v Coventry City live team news and updates as Sky Blues start life without Mark Robins
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. With Mark Robins being sacked on Thursday, following Wednesday night's 2-1 CBS Arena defeat to Derby County, the Sky Blues will be organised by first team coach Rhys Carr, who has been appointed interim head coach by owner Doug King while the club look for a new man to come in to take charge.

arts.ttl: Chelsea legend 'favourite' to land shock new Coventry City job after Mark Robins sack
arts.sum: Chelsea legend Frank Lampard is currently the favourite to be the next permanent manager of Coventry City following the surprise departure of Mark Robins this week. Robins had taken City to the brink of Premier League promotion and a second FA Cup final appearance during his time at the club.

arts.ttl: Coventry City next manager latest as new favourite emerges
arts.sum: Chelsea legend and former Derby County and Everton manager Frank Lampard has emerged as the short-priced favourite to replace Mark Robins as the next boss of Coventry City. Lampard has been out of work since the summer of 2023, when he'd been brought back to Chelsea to oversee the remainder of the season as caretaker boss.

arts.ttl: Coventry City's formula for misery & failure v recipe for excitement & success
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. A little later it struck me that I retired in 2017, a fortnight before Robins began his second spell as City manager.

arts.ttl: Saturday's Championship predictions including Sunderland vs. Coventry
arts.sum: Sports Mole provides score predictions and previews for all of today's Championship fixtures, including Sunderland vs. Coventry.

arts.ttl: Shocked Coventry City star makes Mark Robins prediction after Sky Blues sacking
arts.sum: “There are a lot of emotions and feeling and people are going to feel different ways about the news but in terms of the lads they have to park it the best they can for a couple of days and go up there and give a performance,” he said. Turning his attention to today’s match at league leaders Sunderland, where he will be absent due to recovering from a knee ligament strain, Bidwell insists his teammates have to put aside the emotions of the last couple of days and put on a performance for the travelling fans.
